config.question: How did the character of Eugene V. Debs compare to the popular image of an activist leader?

choices.content: Debs was gentle and reflective, rather than a wild-eyed radical.
Debs was organized and highly efficient, rather than a disorganized leader.
Debs lacked passion and drive, as opposed to a passionate radical.
Debs was fiery and frantic, in keeping with the image of a crazed activist.

answer_3.response: Consider This: Eugene Debs was an excellent speaker, a passionate leader, and committed to the cause of socialism. However, he lacked effective organization and a cohesive platform. See L.O. 23.1 The Spirit of Progressivism.
